abstract: Christopher Gray Streetscapes column on the history of mansion built in 1860s on Fifth Avenue and 57th Street for Mary Mason Jones, a distant relative of author Edith Wharton; gradually, what was known as Marble Row for its opulent structures was chewed up by conversion and demolition.
lead_paragraph: In “The Age of Innocence,” Edith Wharton modeled the character of a house-building aristocrat, Mrs. Manson Mingott, on an aunt, Mary Mason Jones. Mrs. Jones built not only a grand trendsetting mansion, but an investment row from East 57th to 58th.

headline.print_headline: A Woman With an Architectural Appetite
headline.seo: Streetscapes | A Woman With an Architectural Appetite
